Write your cross-references as with markdown…

{status}

This shall render a macro.

In …

{note}

Note the TWO backticks ``

  • Note 1
  • And here is some text

{info}

Note the TWO backticks ``

No Title

  • Info
  • And here is some text

With Title

  • Info
  • And here is some text

{warning}

Note the TWO backticks ``

No title

  • Warning
  • And here is some text

With title

  • Warning
  • And here is some text

{code}

Note the THREE backticks ```

// Write your code as usual...
(function () {
  console.log('This gets converted...')
})()

{plantuml}

@startuml

' Write your plantuml code as usual...

actor Foo1
boundary Foo2
control Foo3
entity Foo4
database Foo5

Foo1 --> Foo2 : To boundary
Foo1 --> Foo3 : To control
Foo1 --> Foo4 : To entity
Foo1 --> Foo5 : To database

@enduml

@startuml

Alice --> Bob : Hello Bob
Alice <.. Bob : Hi Alice

@enduml
